guide.introduction: Make and toss a bunch of these inexpensive little lights to add color to any ferromagnetic surface in your neighborhood.
guide.introduction_rendered:
Make and toss a bunch of these inexpensive little lights to add color to any ferromagnetic surface in your neighborhood.

Relevant parts
  • LED
  • Tape
  • Batteries
  • Disc magnet
  • Epoxy

parts.notes: 20 cents each from HB Electronic Components (http://hebeiltd.com.cn).
One roll will make many throwies.
25 count for about $15 from Amazing Magnets  (http://amazingmagnets.com).
Weather-resistant alternative to tape. Available from  Newark InOne (http://newark.com).

lines.text: Pinch the LED’s leads to the battery terminals, with the longer lead (the anode) touching the positive terminal (+) of the battery, and the shorter lead (the cathode) touching negative (-).
lines.text_raw: Pinch the LED’s leads to the battery terminals, with the longer lead (the anode) touching the positive terminal (+) of the battery, and the shorter lead (the cathode) touching negative (-).

lines.text: Confirm that the LED lights up.
lines.text_raw: Confirm that the LED lights up.

lines.text: Tape the LED leads to the battery by cutting off a 7" piece of strapping tape and wrapping it once around both sides of the battery. Keep the tape very tight as you wrap. The LED should not flicker.
lines.text_raw: Tape the LED leads to the battery by cutting off a 7" piece of strapping tape and wrapping it once around both sides of the battery. Keep the tape very tight as you wrap. The LED should not flicker.

lines.text: Place the magnet on the positive terminal of the battery, and continue to wrap the tape tightly until it’s all done. The magnet should hold firmly to the battery.
lines.text_raw: Place the magnet on the positive terminal of the battery, and continue to wrap the tape tightly until it’s all done. The magnet should hold firmly to the battery.

lines.text: The battery’s positive contact surface extends around the sides of the battery. Don’t let the LED’s cathode touch the positive terminal, or you’ll short the circuit.
lines.text_raw: The battery’s positive contact surface extends around the sides of the battery. Don’t let the LED’s cathode touch the positive terminal, or you’ll short the circuit.

lines.text: That’s it — you’re ready to throw (or make a few dozen more). Throw it up high and in quantity to impress your friends and city officials.
lines.text_raw: That’s it — you’re ready to throw (or make a few dozen more). Throw it up high and in quantity to impress your friends and city officials.

lines.text: A throwie will shine for about 1-2 weeks, depending on the weather and the LED color. To get one off a ferro-magnetic surface, don’t pull it, or it may come apart.  Instead, apply a lateral force to the magnet base, and slide it off the surface while lifting it with a fingernail or tool.
lines.text_raw: A throwie will shine for about 1-2 weeks, depending on the weather and the LED color. To get one off a ferro-magnetic surface, don’t pull it, or it may come apart.  Instead, apply a lateral force to the magnet base, and slide it off the surface while lifting it with a fingernail or tool.

lines.text: Throwies naturally chain together in your pocket, making multi-segmented  throwie bugs, which will also stick to metal surfaces if they aren’t too long.
